message: has anyone here created an app with a login page, username and pass? if yes how do you code it so that it store sessions, therefore you don't have to login each time... I am looking for a tutorial that would help me do this.. suggestions are welcomed
Yep, you use the keychain for this.  See http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/#documentation/Security/Conceptual/keychainServConcepts/01introduction/introduction.html
was wondering why the facebook iOS code doesn't use this
they use a session or something in their code
is that because they have a single sign on?

Yeah, I think so.  If you pop up a form or UIWebView in your own app, then there's nothing to stop you from stealing user's passwords.  The Facebook SDK tries to avoid this wherever possible by passing you through the official Facebook app, failing that Safari, failing that its own form that only supplies a token to your delegate.
When authentication is passed through Safari, Safari uses the keychain to store your details.  I assume it's the same for the official Facebook app.
